article.headline: The U.K. economy collapsed by a record 20.4% in April
article.body: U.K. gross domestic product collapsed by a record 20.4% in April, the Office for National Statistics said Friday. That followed a 5.8% drop in March, and the economy fell 10.4% in the three months ending April. "Virtually all areas of the economy were hit, with pubs, education, health and car sales all giving the biggest contributions to this historic fall," said Jonathan Athow, deputy national statistician for economic statistics.
